channel.title: SevenAtSevenSection1
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenSection1, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mahmood Mamdani on how Uganda's history shaped his belonging — and his son's moment

item.title: The Warner Bros. Curse
item.description: Warner Bros. has a history of disastrous mergers and acquisitions. Can they avoid another bad sequel as Netflix and Paramount battle to buy it?

item.title: Teachers are using software to see if students used AI. What happens when it's wrong?

item.title: Built to spill: The life of a crash test dummy
item.description: Automotive crash test dummies are born in Ohio, brought to "life" near Detroit, and then sent around the world to make cars safer.

item.title: Republicans divided on policy toward Afghan immigrants after shooting

item.title: VCs discuss why most consumer AI startups still lack staying power
item.description: The next consumer tech revolution may require an introduction of a new personal device.

item.title: Solo VC and Lovable investor Neil Murray raises third Nordic-focused fund

item.title: Disney’s OpenAI deal is exclusive for just one year — then it’s open season
item.description: After the one year is up, Disney is free to sign similar deals with other AI companies.

item.title: I hate that I love Riverside’s AI-driven ‘Rewind’ for podcasters
item.description: Riverside's year-end review is amusing, but it represents a creative culture that's increasingly entwined with AI.

item.title: An aspiring neurosurgeon and a campus Republican died in the Brown campus shooting

item.description: Chai is building foundation models for drug discovery, specifically to predict interactions between molecules so they could be reprogramed for cures.
